content: The link for the <1>{{role}}</1> role is successfully copied to clipboard.

comment.text: This translation key is used to display a success message when copying a link to a specific role. It appears in a share dialog component and indicates that the role has been successfully copied to the clipboard.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Arabic translation includes a space before the opening angle bracket '<'. This should be removed to match the English format.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: تم نسخ الرابط الخاص بدور<1>{{role}}</1>بنجاح إلى الحافظة.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'nüxsələndi' is not the most accurate translation of 'copied' in this context. It carries a meaning closer to 'transferred' or 'written down'. A more suitable translation would be 'kopyalandı'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Change 'nüxsələndi' to 'kopyalandı'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The verb 'is' (е) doesn't agree with the noun 'link' (линкът). 'Link' is masculine singular, so the past participle 'копирана' should agree with it. The correct form would be 'копиран'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Линкът за ролята <1>{{role}}</1> е успешно копиран в системния буфер.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The tags <1>{{role}}</1> are not correctly formatted. The closing tag should be </1>.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Replace </1> with </1>.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The HTML tags <1> and </1> are not correctly translated. They should remain as-is to preserve the intended formatting.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Keep the HTML tags as <1> and </1>.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The angle brackets `<1>{{role}}</1>` are inconsistent. The closing bracket should be `</1>` not `</1>`.

The Japanese translation retains the <1>{{role}}</1> tags from the English content. These tags should typically be removed in translation unless they are specifically required for the target language's formatting.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Remove the <1>{{role}}</1> tags. The translated text should be: {{role}}役割のリンクがクリップボードに正常にコピーされました。

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Latvian translation "Lomas <1>{{role}}</1> saite" is not the most natural way to express 'The link for the <1>{{role}}</1> role'.  'Lomas' (roles) is technically correct, but it's a bit clunky. A more natural phrasing would incorporate 'loma' (role) in a way that emphasizes possession or association.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Vienas lomas <1>{{role}}</1> saite ir veiksmīgi nokopēta starpliktuvē.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The `<1>{{role}}</1>` tags are inconsistent with the English. While they exist in both, they do not serve a clear function.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider whether these tags are necessary for the target system and what their purpose is. If they are for formatting/markup, ensure consistency in both languages.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Dutch translation correctly replicates the angle brackets (<1> and </1>) from the English content. No formatting issues.
While technically correct, 'is gekopieerd' (is copied) sounds a bit awkward in Dutch. A more natural phrasing would be 'is overgenomen'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: De link voor de <1>{{role}}</1> rol is overgenomen naar het klembord.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Polish translation retains the HTML tags `<1>` and `</1>`. These tags are likely not intended for display and should be removed or replaced with appropriate formatting for Polish text (e.g., plain text, markdown).
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Remove the tags: Link do roli {{role}} został pomyślnie skopiowany do schowka.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation maintains the `<1>` and `</1>` tags, which is appropriate for preserving the original formatting. No changes needed here.
The angle brackets `<1>` and `</1>` are inconsistent between the English and Portuguese versions. The English version uses `<1>` and `</1>`, while the Portuguese version uses the same.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Ensure consistent use of angle brackets. Should it be `<1>{{role}}</1>` or `<1>{{role}}</1>` in Portuguese as well?

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Romanian translation retains the HTML tags <1>{{role}}</1>. This should ideally be removed or adapted for a more natural Romanian sentence structure. The tags are unnecessary in the translated context and may cause display issues.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Remove the tags: 'Link-ul către rolul {{role}} a fost copiat cu succes în clipboard.'

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Sinhala translation retains the `<1>` and `</1>` tags from the English content. These tags are unnecessary and should be removed.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Remove the `<1>` and `</1>` tags. The translation should be: "{{role}} භූමිකාව සඳහා වූ සම්බන්ධය සාර්ථකව ක්ලිප්බෝඩ් එකට පිටපත් කරන ලදී."

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The angle brackets `<1>` and `</1>` are inconsistent with typical Slovak translation practices. They seem to be remnants of the original English content's formatting and should be removed or replaced with a more appropriate format, if any is needed to convey emphasis or special context.  In this case, they are unnecessary and disrupt the flow.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Remove the angle brackets entirely.  The translation should be: 'Odkaz pre rolu {{role}} je úspešne skopírovaný do schránky.'

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Slovenian translation retains the HTML tags `<1>` and `</1>`. This is unnecessary and deviates from standard localization practices. These tags should be removed.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Remove the `<1>` and `</1>` tags. The translated text should be "Povezava za vlogo {{role}} je uspešno kopirana v odložišče."

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Serbian translation maintains the `<1>` and `</1>` tags which are likely not intended for display to the user and may cause rendering issues. These tags should ideally be removed or adapted for the target platform's markup language.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Remove the `<1>` and `</1>` tags from the translation. The final text should be "Линк за улогу {{role}} је успешно копиран у међумеморију."

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While technically correct, "међумеморија" (intermemory) is not the most natural way to say "clipboard" in Serbian. A more common and user-friendly translation would be "клипоборд" (clipboard) or "свеска".
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Replace "међумеморија" with "клипоборд" or "свеска".  For example: "Линк за улогу {{role}} је успешно копиран у клипоборд."

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Serbian translation 'Link za ulogu <1>{{role}}</1> je uspešno kopiran u međumemoriju' translates literally to 'Link for the role <1>{{role}}</1> is successfully copied to clipboard.'. While technically correct, a more natural phrasing in Serbian would be 'Link za <1>{{role}}</1> je uspešno kopiran u međumemoriju.' or 'Link za ulogu <1>{{role}}</1> uspešno je kopiran u međumemoriju.'
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Link za <1>{{role}}</1> je uspešno kopiran u međumemoriju.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The angle brackets <1> and </1> are not properly closed in the Ukrainian translation. While they are present, the closing tag is missing a closing bracket.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Посилання для ролі <1>{{role}}</1> успішно скопійовано до буфера обміну.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Chinese translation preserves the `<1>` and `</1>` tags. These tags are not standard in Chinese and should ideally be removed or handled appropriately based on the platform's requirements.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Remove the `<1>` and `</1>` tags from the Chinese translation.  The content within the tags is already correctly formatted within the sentence.
